body_html:
As an example, in our old input pipeline, we needed to evaluate the current size of the RandomShuffleQueues several times within the session block, in order to efficiently be able to switch between training and validation queues. For these evaluations we needed three separate session.run(rsq.size) calls, that evaluated nothing else and that always triggered all hooks, even though nothing in the weights had changed in the meantime. So for example LoggingTensorHook would log the same tensors with exactly the same values 4 times in the same global step.
So, here it would have been nice to tell the hooks to just ignore the session.run(rsq.size) calls.

body:
As an example, in our old input pipeline, we needed to evaluate the current size of the RandomShuffleQueues several times within the session block, in order to efficiently be able to switch between training and validation queues. For these evaluations we needed three separate session.run(rsq.size) calls, that evaluated nothing else and that always triggered all hooks, even though nothing in the weights had changed in the meantime. So for example LoggingTensorHook would log the same tensors with exactly the same values 4 times in the same global step. 
So, here it would have been nice to tell the hooks to just ignore the session.run(rsq.size) calls.
